column5: The National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) promotes the U.S. economy and public welfare by providing Technical Leadership for the nation’s measurement and standards infrastructure. NIST’s responsibilities include the development of management, administrative, technical, and physical standards and guidelines for the cost-effective security and privacy of other than national security-related information in Federal information systems. In advancing its mission objectives, NIST provides the National Vulnerability Database (NVD) and the National Checklist Program (NCP) to provide a data repository that contains security automation reference data for managing software vulnerabilities and configurations to support security management activities.     NIST’s objectives for this requirement include analysis of software identification and characterization data, vulnerability data, configuration checklists, and other related securi

column4: AI RMF Global Engagement on AI Standards
column5: The purpose of this contract is to drive AI innovation through methodologies to which guide organizational risk management of AI . The contractor shall provide support services in conducting stakeholder activities for the development and ongoing support of the NIST AI RMF and the AI RMF Playbook in private sector contexts. NIST requires assistance in maintaining multi-stakeholder engagement and the operationalization of the NIST AI RMF across various contexts.

column4: New Base Contract with 4-Option Years for NWS WFO Boston-Norton Radar HVAC Preventative Maintenance
column5: Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning (HVAC) Preventative Maintenance is critical for the NEXRAD weather radar as it controls the temperature for equipment that is critical for weather forecast and warning operations, especially detection of severe weather and tornadoes. Without the radar, there will be grave danger to Safety of human life/protection of property.  Base contract with 4-Option YearsBase Year   1 May 2025 to 30 April 2026Reference 1305M324P0336   See attached Statement of Work NOAA Obligation Approval Request Form is in the process

column5: As part of its mission to manage NOAA’s Information Technology (IT) security program, the Office of the Chief Information Officer (OCIO), Cyber Security Division (CSD) requires support to continue operations for NOAA’s Cyber Security Center (NCSC). The contractor will provide the tools and capabilities to enable a comprehensive solution to CSD’s mission. The contractor will support services as well as the integration of future infrastructure, hardware, software, processes and procedures into NOAA’s current cybersecurity environment

column4: SAMOA HUDSON BUILDING UPGRADE and REPAIRS
column5: GML is requesting bids from well-qualified vendors who can submit qualifications and pricing and demonstrate substantial experience in general contracting. GML is looking to award a contract to one vendor to make repairs and upgrades to the existing Hudson Building.  Interior renovations to include: reconfiguring the walls and interior spaces, new flooring, wall paint, ceiling, lighting, and both mechanical (HVAC system and ducting) and electrical distribution (upgraded breaker panel, outlets, and switches) systems. On the exterior, renovations to include:  replacing the windows and complete roof system (sheathing, metal roof, etc.), cleaning and repainting the exterior of the building, and an upgraded entrance. The current building layout includes an interior wall that partitions the space into two rooms plus an additional small storage closet. The reconfigured space will remove the interior wall to open up the space into one large

column5: Unprecedented increases in FirstNet Authority’s server virtualization cost in Fiscal Year 2025 (FY25) and onward; combined with FirstNet Authority Office of the Chief Information Officer’s (OCIO) requirement to reduce datacenter footprint have made it critical to consolidate the organization’s storage, computing, and networking into a single platform. This approach, known as Hyperconverged Infrastructure (HCI), will fulfill the space reduction requirement while improving cost efficiency in capital and operational expenses with no loss or degradation of services.

column4: Technical Support and StrategicCommunication for NIST ArtificialIntelligence Programs and Initiatives
column5: The scope of this task is to support the critical and emerging technology program and initiativeswith a focus on NIST Artificial Intelligence efforts, including continued implementation of itsresponsibilities under relevant laws and AI Executive Orders.The Contractor shall provide technical, communications, and stakeholder engagement supportservices. The Contractor shall provide advice and guidance on technology policy matters related totrustworthy and responsible artificial intelligence in support of the adoption of the AI RiskManagement Framework (RMF), and other NIST AI guidance efforts.

column5: This requirement will provide both engineering and program support to the SLEP program, in ways such as design and production review and assessment, engineering support for deployment of systems to all geographic locations, management of the Integrated Master Schedule of the entire project, budget tracking and management support, and other tasks as needed by the program and project managers.  Because much of the engineering support required through production and deployment of the new system is non-recurring engineering, and because the schedule is complex in integrates several interrelated tasks in diverse areas, and also because the budget is incorporated into Construction Work in Progress (CWIP) tracking, continued support of contractor labor will be needed through the completion of the ASOS SLEP project.

column4: Contract Vialing of monoclonal antibody reference material
column5: NIST intends to develop a monoclonal antibody expressed from the NISTCHO reference cell line as a NIST Reference Material (NIST RM).  The material is intended to be highly representative of CHO-expressed monoclonal antibodies used as biopharmaceuticals.  This reference material is planned to be a companion molecule to both the NISTmAb (RM 8671) monoclonal antibody reference material (reference product) and the NISTCHO (RM 8675) cell line reference material (non-originator expressing cell line).  As such, the NIST Biomolecular Structure and Function group intends to contract vialing each of these monoclonal antibody reference materials to produce several future lots of both NISTmAb RM 8671 and cNISTmAb RM 8672.  These materials will be released with quantitative data traceable to fundamental units of measurement, and are expected to be utilized as a system suitability tools in the biopharmaceutical industry. 30,000 vials of each material

column5: The need for Artificial Intelligence standards and best practices that address interoperability, usability, and privacy continues to be critical for the Nation. NIST continues to align its resources to enable greater development and application of practical, innovative security technologies and methodologies that enhance our ability to address current and future information security challenges, especially in the context of critical and emerging technologies.In alignment with the OMB Memorandum M-25-21, "Accelerating Federal Use of AI through Innovation, Governance, and Public Trust," NIST seeks to strengthen its leadership in responsible AI adoption by promoting AI maturity, advancing risk-informed governance, and fostering public trust. This SOW reflects that intent by integrating principles from M-25-21 and Executive Order 14179 into its technical, strategic, and engagement tasks.

column4: WxCoder and STAMS Systems, Operations & Maintenance (July 10, 2025- July 9, 2026)
column5: An Additional Work Statement (AWS) is required by the National Weather Service (NWS) to fund Operations and Maintenance of the XcCoder and Station Metadata System (STAMS).  The WxCoder will continue to provide the NWS Cooperative Observer Program (COOP) the means to report daily weather observations from nearly 8,000 locations in the USA, Pacific, and Caribbean.  The O&M also includes  the a new function to operate and maintain the metadata and station maintenance system (STAMS) for all the COOP sites.

column5: NOAA is recapitalizing its facilities at the National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS) Northwest Fisheries Science Center (NWFSC or NWC) Montlake Laboratory Campus.  The project will utilize a Design-Build delivery method contract to complete all code required improvements (seismic-structural upgrades, fire and life safety, and mechanical, electrical, and plumbing work) such that no additional capital level investments are required for at least another 20 years. In addition to this code required work, renovations and reconfigurations to improve the efficiency and utilization of the campus programming will be performed. The project budget is between $50M and $70M. The requirements for the Design-Build project will be developed by an AE1 contractor via an AE IDIQ Task Order.

column5: The Contractor shall produce 4,000 vials of each of the four serum materials at the concentrations specified below, with each vial containing (1.1 ± 0.1) mL of serum.  The Contractor shall acquire a minimum of 16 L of serum pooled according to the CLSI C37 A Guideline (https://clsi.org/standards/products/clinical-chemistry-and-toxicology/documents/c37/; Clin Chem Lab Med. 2020 Feb 25;58(3):368-374. doi: 10.1515/cclm-2019-0732).  All vitamin D metabolite levels must be native and not achieved through dilution or fortification of any of the serum samples, except for Level 4, which will require fortification with 3-epi-25(OH)D3. The serum shall be aliquoted into vials, specified in Section III, that are capable of withstanding long-term storage (5 to 10 years) at -80 °C.

column4: High-energy X-ray diffractometer with silver radiation
column5: High-energy X-ray diffractometer with conventional sealed X-ray tube. X-ray source target shall be silver, and the diffractometer shall have the ability to accept other standard conventional X-ray tubes. Independently driven omega and 2theta circles. Optical encoding system for goniometer positioning and accuracy: i. Minimum step size 0.0001°; ii. Step size reproducibility +/- 0.0005°. 1D (line) detector with >40 % efficiency for silver radiation; single-photon counting; dynamic range >10,000,000 cps; pixel size < 60µm; fast readout <90 µs; energy discrimination against fluorescence. Sample holder for capillaries capable of spinning. Sample holder for flat samples for transmission measurements. Reproducible positioning of optics and stages allowing alignment-free exchange of system optics, x-ray sources, detectors, and sample stages.

column4: P0449.02 NOS Beaufort NC Reconfigure Existing Spaces
column5: P0449.02 NOS Beaufort NC Reconfigure Existing Spaces: Provide Design-Build services as required to reconfigure existing spaces at the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) National Ocean Service (NOS) Beaufort Laboratory Campus in Beaufort, North Carolina. The reconfigured spaces will provide temporary office, laboratory and other functional space to offset the space that was lost following the abrupt and permanent closure of Building 2.

column4: Dynamic Directed Energy Deposition System for in situ X-ray Characterization of Additive Manufacturing
column5: The purpose of this acquisition is to acquire a flexible, high-throughput laser-based directed energy deposition (DED) system for in situ characterization of materials’ structural evolution during additive manufacturing (AM) using X-ray scattering. This system will enable rapid exploration of AM’s broad composition and processing space, support the development of critically needed metrology for characterizing the rapid structural transformation dynamics during AM, and generate benchmark and validation datasets for U.S. industry.

column4: Triple Quadrupole Mass Spectrometer with Thermal Desorption-Based Ambient Ionization Source
column5: The Surface and Trace Chemical Analysis Group of the Materials Measurement Science Division within the Material Measurement Laboratory leads research efforts that directly support forensic science, public health, and homeland security communities. In response to the TRANQ Research Act, NIST intends to identify and validate in-field analytical technologies capable of delivering reliable drug analysis data that is comparable to NIST’s laboratory-based measurement platform (i.e. RaDAR). To support this goal, NIST built a mobile laboratory to serve as a technology test bed equipped with advanced field instrumentation for the qualitative and quantitative analysis of drugs such as synthetic opioids and other emerging threats in the field. To enable accurate in-field quantitative measurements, we require the procurement of a triple quadrupole mass spectrometer with a thermal desorption-based ambient ionization source.

column5: The Materials Science and Engineering Division (MSED) is involved in the characterization of aqueous soluble polymers, proteins, and model therapeutic-loaded nanoparticles. These materials require characterization for absolute molar mass by size-exclusion chromatography with triple-detection: refractive index, multi-angle light scattering, and UV-Vis spectroscopic detection.    Additional detection options are included to provide sensitivity to charge and fluorescence detection and flow fractionation modules. MSED requires an aqueous size-exclusion chromatography instrument for absolute molar mass characterization. Procurement options are specified for manual cuvettes and automated measurements by a module containing dynamic, static and electrophoretic light scattering (DLS/SLS/ELS) and field-flow fractionation (FFF).
